twofa.description: 2FA is enabled for your account. Please enter your authentication code to continue.
twofa.title: Two-Factor Authentication Required

validation.email_invalid: Please enter a valid email address
validation.password_min_length: Password must be at least 8 characters

form.affected_monitors_description: Select the monitors that will be affected by this maintenance
form.maintenance_time_window: Maintenance Time Window of a Day

confirm_action.pause_description: Are you sure you want to pause this maintenance?
confirm_action.resume_description: Are you sure you want to resume this maintenance?
confirm_action.title: Confirm Action

confirm_delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this maintenance window? This action cannot be undone.
confirm_delete.title: Confirm Delete

empty_state.description: Get started by creating your first maintenance window to prevent scheduled downtimes.
empty_state.title: No maintenance windows found

toasts.toggle_error: Cannot toggle maintenance status: ID is missing

messages.login_no_tokens: Login successful but no tokens received
messages.register_no_tokens: Registration successful but no tokens received

empty_state.description: Get started by creating your first monitor to track the health of your services.
empty_state.title: No monitors found

docker.ca_cert_description: Paste your Certificate Authority certificate in PEM format.
docker.client_cert_description: Paste your client certificate in PEM format. This is used for mutual TLS authentication.
docker.hostname_mismatch: "x509: certificate is valid for X, not Y":
docker.hostname_mismatch_solution: Ensure the hostname matches the certificate's SAN or disable verification (not recommended).
docker.legacy_cert_error: "x509: certificate relies on legacy Common Name field":
docker.legacy_cert_solution: Add the hostname to Subject Alternative Names (SAN) in your certificate.
docker.mtls_note: For mutual TLS (mTLS), you need to provide both client certificate and private key. The CA certificate is used to verify the server's certificate.
docker.private_key_description: Paste your private key in PEM format. Keep this secure!
docker.unknown_authority_solution: Provide the correct CA certificate that signed the server certificate.

grpc.invert_keyword_description: The monitor will be marked as UP if the keyword is NOT found
grpc.keyword_description: Search for this keyword in the response

advanced.ignore_tls: Ignore TLS/SSL errors for HTTPS websites
advanced.ignore_tls_description: Skip TLS certificate validation. Use with caution - this makes connections less secure.
advanced.max_redirects_description: Maximum number of redirects to follow (0-30). Set to 0 to disable redirects.
advanced.title: Advanced

authentication.oauth_scope_placeholder: Optional: Space separated list of scopes
authentication.title: Authentication

options.text_example:
Example Text:
Any plain text content here...
options.title: HTTP Options

http_keyword.invert_keyword_description: Look for the keyword to be absent rather than present.

kafka.auto_topic_creation_description: Allow the producer to automatically create the topic if it doesn't exist
kafka.brokers_description: List of Kafka broker addresses (host:port format)
kafka.enable_ssl_description: Use SSL/TLS encryption for the connection
kafka.message_description: The message content to send to the topic (JSON format recommended)
kafka.topic_description: The Kafka topic to produce messages to

mongodb.command_description: MongoDB command to execute as JSON. Defaults to ping if not specified.
mongodb.connection_string_description: MongoDB connection string. Supports both standard (mongodb://) and DNS seedlist (mongodb+srv://) formats.
mongodb.expected_value_description: Expected value to compare against the JSON path result.
mongodb.json_path_description: JSON path to extract value from response. Use $ for root level.

validation.expected_value_required: Expected value is required when check type is json-query
validation.json_path_required: JSON path is required when check type is json-query
validation.success_keyword_required: Success keyword is required when check type is keyword

ping.count_description: Number of packets to send before stopping
ping.global_timeout_description: Automatically calculated as: (count × per-request timeout) + 2s margin
ping.per_request_timeout_description: Maximum waiting time before considering a single ping lost
ping.title: Ping Settings

push.url_description: Use this URL in your service to report status. Make an HTTP request (POST/GET) to this endpoint to send a heartbeat.

rabbitmq.health_checks_description: The monitor checks the {{code}} endpoint on each node and returns UP if any node is healthy.
rabbitmq.management_nodes_description: Enter the URL for the RabbitMQ management nodes including protocol and port. Example: https://node1.rabbitmq.com:15672
rabbitmq.password_description: Password for RabbitMQ management interface authentication
rabbitmq.setup_information_description: To use the RabbitMQ monitor, you need to enable the Management Plugin in your RabbitMQ setup. For more information, please consult the RabbitMQ documentation.
rabbitmq.title: RabbitMQ Configuration
rabbitmq.username_description: Username for RabbitMQ management interface authentication

redis.ca_certificate_description: Root CA certificate in PEM format. Required for proper TLS verification with self-signed certificates.
redis.client_certificate_description: Client certificate in PEM format. Required for mutual TLS authentication.
redis.client_key_description: Client private key in PEM format. Must be provided together with client certificate.
redis.connection_string_description: Redis connection string format: {{redis}} or {{rediss}} for TLS
redis.ignore_tls_description: Skip TLS certificate verification (not recommended for production)
redis.title: Redis Configuration

intervals.max_retries_description: Maximum retries before the service is marked as down and a notification is sent
intervals.resend_notification: Resend Notification if Down X times consecutively (Resend disabled)

notifications.no_channels: No notification channels found, create one first
notifications.title: Notification channels

snmp.community_description: The SNMP community string for authentication (like a password)
snmp.expected_value_description: The value to compare against. Leave empty to skip validation.
snmp.host_description: The hostname or IP address of the SNMP-enabled device
snmp.json_path_description: JSONPath expression to extract value from response (use "$" for raw value)
snmp.json_path_operator_description: How to compare the extracted value with the expected value
snmp.oid_description: The SNMP Object Identifier to query (e.g., 1.3.6.1.2.1.1.1.0 for system description)
snmp.snmp_version_description: The SNMP protocol version to use
snmp.title: SNMP Settings

sqlserver.allowed_statements_description: SELECT, SHOW, DESCRIBE, EXPLAIN, WITH, and VALUES.
sqlserver.query_description: Query to execute for health check. Leave empty to use default
sqlserver.title: Microsoft SQL Server Connection

type.push: Push Monitor (external service calls a generated URL)

page.description: Create a new monitor to start tracking your website's performance.

delete.description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete monitor and all related data.
delete.title: Are you absolutely sure?

pause.description: Are you sure want to pause?
pause.title: Confirmation

reset.description: This will permanently delete all heartbeat history and uptime statistics for this monitor. The monitor will appear as if it was just created. This action cannot be undone.
reset.title: Reset Monitor Data

notifications.confirm_delete_description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the notifier "{{name}}" and remove it from all monitors that use it.

empty_state.description: Get started by creating your first notification channel to send alerts to your team.
empty_state.title: No notification channels found

discord.bot_display_name_description: The name that will appear as the sender of the Discord messages.
discord.custom_message_prefix_description: Optional prefix that will be added to the beginning of all messages.
discord.custom_message_prefix_placeholder: Optional: Add a prefix to your message
discord.forum_post_name_description: The name of the new forum post that will be created.
discord.sending_message_to_description: Choose where to send Discord messages.
discord.setup_webhook_description_1: Get your webhook URL from Discord server settings → Integrations → Webhooks.
discord.setup_webhook_description_2: Create a new webhook and copy the URL. Make sure you selected the correct channel.
discord.thread_id_description_1: Enable Developer Mode in Discord User Settings → Advanced → Developer Mode
discord.thread_id_description_2: Right-click on the thread or post and select "Copy Thread ID" or "Copy Channel ID"
discord.thread_id_description_title: The ID of the thread or forum post where messages will be sent

gotify.application_token_description: The application token from your Gotify application. You can find this in your Gotify web interface under Apps.
gotify.custom_message_description_2: Leave empty to use the default message.
gotify.custom_title_description: Custom title for the notification. Available variables: {{ msg }}, {{ monitor.name }}, {{ status }}, {{ heartbeat.* }}. Leave empty to use the default "Peekaping" title.
gotify.learn_more_label: Learn more about Gotify and how to set it up at:
gotify.note_description: You need to have a Gotify server running to use this integration.
gotify.priority_description: Message priority (0-10). Higher numbers represent higher priority. Default is 8.
gotify.server_url_description: The URL of your Gotify server. Make sure it's accessible from this application.

grafana_oncall.grafana_oncall_url_description: The webhook URL from your Grafana OnCall integration. You can find this in your Grafana OnCall instance under Alerts & IRM > IRM > Integrations > Webhook.
grafana_oncall.learn_more_label: Learn more about Grafana OnCall webhooks

line.channel_access_token_description: You can get your channel access token from the
line.channel_access_token_description_2: Navigate to your channel settings and look for
line.channel_access_token_placeholder: Enter your LINE channel access token
line.template_description: Customize the message format. Available variables
line.user_id_description: You can find your User ID in the
line.user_id_description_2: Navigate to your channel settings and look for

matrix.access_token_description: Your Matrix access token for authentication
matrix.homeserver_url_description: The URL of your Matrix homeserver
matrix.internal_room_id_description: The internal room ID where notifications will be sent. This should start with "!" and look like: !roomid:matrix.org
matrix.setup_instructions_1: Create a Matrix account for your bot (or use your existing account)
matrix.setup_instructions_2: Create or join the room where you want to receive notifications
matrix.setup_instructions_3: Get your access token by making a login request
matrix.setup_instructions_4: The response will contain an access_token field - use this as your Access Token
matrix.setup_instructions_5: Find your room's internal ID (starts with "!") in your Matrix client room settings

mattermost.channel_name_description: The channel where notifications will be sent. Leave empty to use the default channel configured in the webhook.
mattermost.icon_emoji_description: Emoji to use as the icon. You can specify two emojis separated by a space (first for up status, second for down status).
mattermost.icon_url_description: URL of an image to use as the icon for the notification message.
mattermost.message_template_description: Customize the message format. Available variables
mattermost.use_message_template_description: Enable to use a custom message template and format.
mattermost.username_description: The username that will appear as the sender of the message.

ntfy.authentication_type_basic_description: Use username and password for basic authentication.
ntfy.authentication_type_none_description: No authentication required. Suitable for public NTFY servers.
ntfy.authentication_type_token_description: Use an access token for authentication.
ntfy.password_required: Password is required for basic authentication
ntfy.priority_description: The priority level of the notification. Higher priorities may trigger different behaviors on the client.
ntfy.server_url_description: The URL of your NTFY server. Use https://ntfy.sh for the public instance.
ntfy.tags_description: Comma-separated tags for categorizing notifications. Available variables
ntfy.title_description: Custom title for the notification. Available variables
ntfy.token_description: Your NTFY access token for authentication.
ntfy.token_required: Token is required for token authentication
ntfy.topic_description: The topic name for your notifications. This will be the channel where notifications are sent.
ntfy.username_required: Username is required for basic authentication

opsgenie.priority_description: Set the priority level for alerts. Default is P3 (Moderate).
opsgenie.region_description: Choose your Opsgenie region. This determines which API endpoint will be used.

pagerduty.auto_resolve_description: Choose what action to take when a monitor comes back up
pagerduty.auto_resolve_do_nothing_description: No action taken on UP status
pagerduty.integration_key_description: Learn how to get your integration key
pagerduty.integration_url_description: The PagerDuty Events API v2 endpoint URL. Defaults to the standard endpoint.
pagerduty.priority_description: The severity level for PagerDuty incidents. Defaults to "warning".

pagertree.authentication_token_description: Optional authentication token for enhanced security. This will be sent in the pagertree-token header.
pagertree.auto_resolve_alerts_description: Automatically resolve PagerTree alerts when the monitor recovers
pagertree.integration_url_description: Enter your PagerTree webhook integration URL.
pagertree.urgency_level_description: Set the default urgency level for alerts sent to PagerTree

pushbullet.access_token_description: Your Pushbullet Access Token. Get it from
pushbullet.channel_tag_description: Send notification to a Pushbullet channel instead of devices
pushbullet.custom_message_template_description: Customize the notification body using template variables:
pushbullet.device_id_description: Send notification to a specific device. Leave empty to send to all devices. You can find device IDs using the

pushover.device_description: Leave blank to send to all devices
pushover.message_title_description: Leave blank to use default title
pushover.more_info_label_2: You can create an application and get your API token at
pushover.more_info_label_3: Your user key can be found at
pushover.notification_sound_down_description: Sound for when monitor goes down
pushover.notification_sound_up_description: Sound for when monitor comes back up

signal.important_description: You cannot mix groups and numbers in recipients!
signal.more_info_label: You can check this URL to view how to set one up:
signal.note_description: You need to have a Signal client with REST API.
signal.number_description: The phone number of your Signal account (sender number).
signal.post_url_description: The URL of your Signal CLI REST API server.
signal.recipients_description: Comma-separated list of phone numbers to send notifications to.

slack.channel_name_description: The channel where the message will be sent. If not specified, the message will be sent to the default channel configured in the webhook.
slack.channel_name_description_2: You can override the default channel by specifying a channel name (e.g., #alerts) or a user (e.g., @username).
slack.channel_notify_description: When enabled, the message will trigger notifications for all channel members. Use with caution to avoid spam.
slack.icon_emoji_description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Must be in the format :emoji_name:
slack.message_format_description_2: Enable to send messages with rich formatting, attachments, and better visual presentation.
slack.username_description: The username that will appear as the sender of the message. If not specified, the default bot name will be used.
slack.webhook_url_description: The webhook URL from your Slack integration. You can find this in your Slack instance under Integrations > Webhooks.

smtp.custom_description: Templatability is achieved via the Liquid templating language.
smtp.custom_description_2: Please refer to the documentation for usage instructions.
smtp.smtp_host_description: Either enter the hostname of the server you want to connect to or localhost if you intend to use a locally configured mail transfer agent

telegram.chat_id_description: You can get your chat ID by sending a message to your bot and clicking "Auto Get" above, or manually via the Telegram API.
telegram.chat_id_not_found: Chat ID not found in the latest update.
telegram.message_thread_id_description: Optional. Used for sending messages to a specific thread (topic) in a forum supergroup.
telegram.no_updates_found: No updates found. Please send a message to your bot first.
telegram.protect_content_description: If enabled, the message content will be protected from forwarding and saving.
telegram.send_silently_description: If enabled, messages will be sent silently (users will receive a notification with no sound).
telegram.server_url_description_2: You can use a custom server. See
telegram.template_description: Customize the message format. Available variables
telegram.template_parse_mode_description: Choose how the message should be parsed. See
telegram.use_template_description: Enable to use a custom message template and format.

webhook.additional_headers_description: Add custom HTTP headers to the webhook request.
webhook.custom_body_description: Customize the request body format. Available variables
webhook.post_url_description: The webhook endpoint URL where notifications will be sent.
webhook.request_body_description_custom: Define your own custom request body format below.
webhook.request_body_description_form_data: Content will be sent as multipart/form-data. You can decode it using json_decode($_POST['data']) in PHP.
webhook.request_body_description_json: Content will be sent as JSON with "application/json" header.

delete_dialog.description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the proxy {{host}}:{{port}}.
delete_dialog.title: Are you absolutely sure?

empty_list.text: Get started by creating your first proxy to use in your monitors.
empty_list.title: No proxies found

messages.failed_to_verify_password: Failed to verify password or start 2FA setup
messages.have_enabled_2fa: You have enabled two-factor authentication (2FA) for your account. This adds an extra layer of security.
messages.scan_qr_code_with_authenticator_app: Scan this QR code with your authenticator app

api_keys.title: API Keys
api_keys.description: Manage your API keys for third-party integrations
api_keys.no_keys_description: Create your first API key to start integrating with external services.

create_dialog.title: Create New API Key
create_dialog.description: Create a new API key for third-party integrations. The key will be shown only once.

success_alert.title: API Key Created Successfully
success_alert.description: Your API key has been created. Copy it now as it won't be shown again:

delete_dialog.title: Delete API Key
delete_dialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete the API key "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this API key? This action cannot be undone.

sendgrid.api_key_description: Your SendGrid API key. You can create one in your SendGrid account under Settings → API Keys. Make sure it has "Mail Send" permissions.
sendgrid.bcc_email_description: Blind carbon copy recipients. Separate multiple emails with commas.
sendgrid.cc_email_description: Carbon copy recipients. Separate multiple emails with commas.
sendgrid.from_email_description: The sender email address. This must be a verified sender in your SendGrid account.
sendgrid.subject_description: Subject line for the email. Supports Liquid templating.
sendgrid.to_email_description: Primary recipient email address. For multiple recipients, use CC or BCC fields.

data_retention.description: Set how many days to keep data (KEEP_DATA_PERIOD_DAYS).
data_retention.title: Data Retention Period

timezone.description: Select your preferred timezone for displaying all times in the app.
timezone.label: Timezone
timezone.title: Timezone

messages.no_monitors_configured: No monitors configured for this status page.
messages.status_page_not_found: Status page not found or is not published.

status_pages.affected_monitors_info: Select monitors that will be affected by this maintenance

delete_dialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete "{{title}}"? This action cannot be undone.
delete_dialog.title: Delete Status Page

status_pages.domain_already_used: Domain {{domain}} is already used by another status page
status_pages.domain_host_warning: This domain is the same as your current host URL. This may cause conflicts.
status_pages.domains_info_warning: Don't forget to add the CNAME records to your DNS for each domain.

messages.create_description: Create a new status page to share your service status with users.
messages.get_started_by_creating_your_first_statu: Get started by creating your first status page.
messages.update_description: Update your status page settings and configuration.

status_pages.published_info: Make this status page available publicly

tags.confirm_delete_description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the tag "{{name}}" and remove it from all monitors.

empty_state.description: Get started by creating your first tag to organize your monitors.
empty_state.title: No tags found

form.color_description: Choose a color for your tag

messages.create_description: Create a new tag to organize and categorize your monitors.
messages.failed_to_load_tag: Failed to load tag. The tag may not exist or you may not have permission to view it.
messages.update_description: Update the tag details to better organize your monitors.
